text: <@U695B1S2X> for FilePathsBase.  It's not very useful if you're only ever dealing with local file system paths, but as soon as you have to start dealing with remote stuff, it's absolutely wonderful.  A huge part of my job is fetching and stashing data, and being able to deal with stuff on an S3 bucket with the same code, and same `Base` file system interface as if it were just local is wonderful.  Also testing is way easier, because you can test code normally used for remote stuff with local stuff
